subject: Management
title: The Change Curve
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Change Curve.

hook.text: A team heard about a merger. First shock, then denial, then anger, then acceptance. Textbook KÃ¼bler-Ross.

buildup.text: People process change like grief: shock, denial, frustration, depression, experiment, decision, integration.

discovery.text: The change curve is predictable. Everyone goes through it, just at different speeds.

twist.text: Leaders who've processed the change expect others to be where they are. But others are still in shock.

climax.text: Map where people are on the curve. Adjust your support: empathy early, energy later.

punchline.text: People aren't resisting. They're processing. Give them the curve.

quiz.question: Why do leaders often misjudge team reactions to change?
options: Leaders have already processed the change and expect others to be at the same stage
Team members always process change faster than their leaders
The change curve only applies to major life events, not work changes
